alert.note: Alert for Western Grant; Western Mineral; Western Pendleton (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Baltimore/Washington (Washington D.C., Central Maryland, Northern Virginia, Eastern West Virginia)
info.headline: Wind Chill Advisory issued January 28 at 9:10PM EST until January 30 at 9:00AM EST by NWS Baltimore/Washington
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 AM EST SATURDAY... ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 4 AM SATURDAY TO 9 AM EST SUNDAY... * WHAT...For the Winter Weather Advisory, snow. Total snow accumulations of 2 to 4 inches. For the Wind Chill Advisory, very cold wind chills. Wind chills as low as 20 below zero. * WHERE...Portions of western Maryland, central, northwest and western Virginia and eastern West Virginia. * WHEN...For the Winter Weather Advisory, until 4 AM EST Saturday. For the Wind Chill Advisory, from 4 AM Saturday to 9 AM EST Sunday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. The cold wind chills could result in hypothermia if precautions are not taken.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. Use caution while traveling outside. Wear appropriate clothing, a hat, and gloves. When venturing outside, watch your first few steps taken on steps, sidewalks, and driveways, which could be icy and slippery, increasing your risk of a fall and injury.

area.areaDesc: Western Grant; Western Mineral; Western Pendleton
